text: Industrial Protocols Cheat Sheet v1.0 - SANS ICS - By Don C. Weber & Justin Searle - This tri-fold cheat sheet provides details about common Industrial protocols that are be found in different areas of control networks.
Fieldbus and Fieldbus Management (Purdue Levels 0-1) - Protocols at the lowest levels of the Purdue Model for control system hierarchy.

metadata.title: Fieldbus and Fieldbus Management Purdue Levels 0-1

text: Site SCADA (Purdue Levels 2-3) - Protocols used at site-level supervisory control and data acquisition systems.
Regional SCADA (Purdue Levels 2-3) - Protocols used for regional supervisory control and data acquisition systems.
OPC DA uses DCOM for TCP/IP communication.
OPC UA Binary uses TCP Port 4840 with TLS encryption.
OPC UA XML uses TCP Ports 80, 443 with TLS encryption.
BACnet/IP uses UDP Port 47808 for Building Automation.
LonTalk uses UDP Ports 1628, 1629 for Building Automation.
Fox (Tridium/Niagara) uses TCP Port 1911 for Building Automation.
KNXnet/IP uses TCP Port 3671 and UDP Port 3671 for Building Automation.
Modbus RTU uses RS-232 or TIA-485 physical layer, supports 247 devices, data rate 9.6 Kbs - 12 Mbs.
Modbus TCP uses TCP Port 502.
Modbus ASCII uses RS-232 or TIA-485 physical layer, supports 65519 devices.
Modbus TLS uses TCP Port 802 with TLS encryption.
DNP3 over TCP/IP uses TCP Port 20000 and UDP Port 20000 with TLS encryption.
WITS over TCP/IP uses TCP Port 20000 and UDP Port 20000 with TLS encryption.
DLMS/COSEM (IEC 62056) uses TCP Port 4059 and UDP Port 4059.
IEC 60870 - IEC 101 is the serial protocol, IEC 104 uses TCP Port 2404 and UDP Port 2404 with TLS encryption.
ICCP/TASE2 uses TCP Port 102.
IEEE C37.118 uses TCP Port 4712 and UDP Port 4713.
IEC 61850 GOOSE uses EtherType 0x88B8.
IEC 61850 GSSE uses EtherType 0x88B9.
IEC 61850 SV (Sampled Values) uses EtherType 0x88BA.
IEC 61850 MMS uses TCP Port 102 with TLS encryption.
IRIG-A time synchronization operates at 1000 bps.
IRIG-B time synchronization operates at 100 bps.
PTP (Precision Time Protocol) uses EtherType 0x88F7.
NTP uses UDP Port 123.
PTP over UDP uses UDP Ports 319, 320.
HART (Highway Addressable Remote Transducer) supports 64 devices at 1.2 - 9.6 Kps data rate.
HART-IP uses TCP Port 5094 and UDP Port 5094.
Wireless HART uses 802.15.4 physical layer, supports 100+ devices.
Foundation Fieldbus FF H1 uses IEC 1158-2 ISAS50.02 physical layer, supports 2-32 devices at 31.25 kbit/s.
Foundation Fieldbus FF H2 operates at 1.0 Mbit/s or 2.5 Mbit/s.
FF HSE (Foundation Fieldbus High Speed Ethernet) uses TCP Ports 1089-1091 and UDP Ports 1089-1091.
CIP (Common Industrial Protocol) family includes DeviceNET, ControlNET, and CompoNET.
DeviceNET uses Twisted Pair physical layer, supports 64 devices at 125 kbit/s, 250 kbit/s, or 500 kbit/s.
ControlNET uses RG-6 Coaxial Cable physical layer, supports 99 devices at 5 Mbit/s.
CompoNET uses TIA-485 physical layer, supports 384 devices at 93.75 kbps - 4 Mbps.
EtherNet/IP uses TCP Port 44818 and UDP Ports 2222, 44818 with TLS or DTLS encryption.
PROFIBUS DP supports 247 devices at 9.6 - 12 Mbit/s data rate.
PROFIBUS PA uses IEC 61158-2 physical layer, supports 32 devices at 31.25 kbit/s.
PROFINET RT uses EtherType 0x8892.
PROFINET uses TCP Ports 34962-34964 and UDP Ports 34962-34964.
FL-net uses TCP Port 55004 and UDP Ports 55000-55004.
P-NET (Process NETwork) uses TIA-485 physical layer, supports 32-125 devices at 76.8 kbit/s.
FIP (Factory Instrumentation Protocol) WorldFIP supports 255 devices at 31.25kbit/s, 1Mbit/s, or 2.5Mbit/s.
INTERBUS is a fieldbus protocol for industrial automation.
CC-Link Link uses TIA-485 physical layer, supports 64 devices at 10 Mbit/s.
CC-Link Control uses EtherType 0x8800.
CC-Link Safety uses TIA-485 physical layer at 10 Mbit/s.
Yokogawa Vnet/IP uses TCP Port 5313 and UDP Port 5313.
Toshiba TCnet RTE uses EtherType 0x888b.
EtherCAT uses EtherType 0x88A4.
EtherCAT UDP uses UDP Port 34980.
Ethernet Powerlink uses EtherType 0x88AB.
EPA (Ethernet for Plant Automation) uses EtherType 0x88BC.

metadata.title: EPA Ethernet for Plant Automation Protocol

text: Sercos I operates at 2 Mbit/s or 4 Mbit/s.
Sercos II operates at 2 Mbit/s, 4 Mbit/s, 8 Mbit/s, or 16 Mbit/s.
Sercos III uses EtherType 0x88CD.
Yaskawa MECHATROLINK-II uses TIA-485 physical layer, supports 30 devices at 10 Mbit/s.
MECHATROLINK-III is the Ethernet version of MECHATROLINK.
CAN (Controller Area Network) family includes CANopen, SAE J1939, and SAE J2284.
CANopen uses CAN physical layer at 10 kbit/s - 1 Mbit/s.
SAE J1939 uses CAN physical layer at 250 kbit/s or 500 kbit/s.
SAE J2284 uses CAN physical layer at 125 kbit/s, 250 kbit/s, or 500 kbit/s.
DoIP (Diagnostics over IP) uses TCP Port 13400 and UDP Port 13400.
